intro: Phyllanthus striaticaulis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, simple leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded or semi-shaded environments. It has a short stem and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value. The species is also noted for its potential medicinal uses in traditional herbal medicine.
